topics.title: Data sovereignty is good…
topics.content: **Data sovereignty** can be defined as the ability for European citizens, businesses, policy makers and other actors to control who **accesses**, **processes** and **alters** their **data**, and **where it is stored**.The **FBDC** projects drives data sovereignty. It aims to create large datasets based on **European** rules, invest in **European** data capabilities and infrastructures, and **empower** corporates, individuals, and SMEs. At the same time, data sovereignty is a **necessary** but **insufficient** condition for **AI sovereignty**!

topics.title: … but AI sovereignty is better!
topics.content: **AI sovereignty** for Europe is the ability to **access** the **most advanced** AI-enabling **technologies** and data on a **global level**, applied according to **European rules** and **values**. In the context of **FBDC**, we establish a **sovereign AI infrastructure** for the selected use cases and also as a **pioneering example** for the **financial industry in Europe**. We pursue different **strategic fields of action**: Develop **own AI methods** and **tools**, Reaching AI sovereignty, whilst not loosing AI competitivness and leverage digital capabilities in the context of **explainable AI** (XAI).
